verbs.description: forwork (third-person singular simple present forworks, present participle forworking, simple past and past participle forworked or forwrought)

entries.meaning: (archaic, transitive) To forfeit (a possession, privilege, etc.); ruin (oneself) by one's own conduct.
(archaic, transitive) To do wrong to; injure; scathe.
(archaic, transitive) To overwork; exhaust with toil.
